result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Louis Martinez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph Louis Martinez in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Defendant Joseph Louis Martinez in custody.  Jeffrey James Altenburg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On motion of the State, Court ordered count 2 dismissed and read-in.
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant ordered to serve 5 months in the House of Correction  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Defendant to undergo a mental health evaluation and cooperate with any treatment.
Defendant to complete 25 hours of community service. 
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges over the duration of probation or, if not paid, a civil judgment will be ordered.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs over the duration of probation failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
NO CONTACT ORDER REMAINS.

At the parties request, case is calendared for a plea and sentencing hearing on 06/19/2015 at 01:30 p.m. in Room 629 of the Courthouse, Judge McAdams presiding.
cab

Attorney Torrie R. Williams in court, defendant Joseph Louis Martinez not in court, in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-02-2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Walmart at 10600 W Layton Ave., Greenfield, WI  53228

Defendant Joseph Louis Martinez in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Defendant Joseph Louis Martinez in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised due to lower pending case this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
